lcInstruction.p: The <frontmatter> and <backmatter> elements are optional in a bookmap. Use them to contain information about the document that appears before or after the main body content, respectively. The <frontmatter> element must appear before the first <chapter> element but after the <bookmeta> element, if present. The <backmatter> element must appear before the <reltable> element but after the <appendix> element, if present.

These elements can contain various content, but are most commonly used to contain the <booklists> element. This element is a container used to indicate to the processor that you want a list of a specific type in that location. Common lists include:
The <toc> element will generate a table of contents where it is placed. No special elements are required, as the hierarchical structure of the map will be used.

The <indexlist> element will generate an index where it is placed. The processor will use <indexterm> elements to generate the index. If there are no <indexterms> in the document, no index entries will be created.

The <glossarylist> element can contain either one or more <topicref> elements linking to glossary entries or one or more <mapref> elements linking to glossary maps. Glossary entries and glossary maps may be used outside of a <glossarylist>, but grouping them within a <glossarylist> allows you to filter and format them more uniformly.

step.cmd: After the <bookmeta> element, add a <frontmatter> element and add content to it as follows.

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE bookmap PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA BookMap//EN" "bookmap.dtd"> <bookmap id="ducks"> ... </bookmeta> <frontmatter> <booklists> <toc/> </booklists> </frontmatter>

step.cmd: After the final <chapter> element, add a <backmatter> element and add content to it as follows.

stepxmp.pre:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE bookmap PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA BookMap//EN" "bookmap.dtd"> <bookmap id="ducks"> ... </chapter>
<backmatter> <booklists> <glossarylist> <mapref href="g_duck_glossgroup.dita"/> </glossarylist> <indexlist/> </booklists> </backmatter>
